member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress
member.summary: Provides an interface to execute System.Actions without surfacing any exceptions raised for that action.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.Swallow(System.Action)
member.summary: Runs the provided action. If the action throws, the exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.Swallow``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Runs the provided function and returns its result. If an exception is thrown, it is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a default value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.returns: Result returned by the provided function or the default value of type in case of exception.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.Swallow``1(System.Func{``0},``0)
member.summary: Runs the provided function and returns its result. If an exception is thrown, it is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a fallback value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.param: Fallback value to return in case of exception.
member.returns: Result returned by the provided function or fallback value in case of exception.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.Swallow(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Logs an exception is logged at Error level if the provided task does not run to completion.
member.param: The task for which to log an error if it does not run to completion.
member.remarks: This method is useful in fire-and-forget situations, where application logic does not depend on completion of task. This method is avoids C# warning CS4014 in such situations.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.SwallowAsync(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Returns a task that completes when a specified task to completes. If the task does not run to completion, an exception is logged at Error level. The returned task always runs to completion.
member.param: The task for which to log an error if it does not run to completion.
member.returns: A task that completes in the state when completes.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.SwallowAsync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Runs async action. If the action throws, the exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method.
member.returns: A task that completes in the state when completes.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.SwallowAsync``1(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: Runs the provided async function and returns its result. If the task does not run to completion, an exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a default value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.returns: A task that represents the completion of the supplied task. If the supplied task ends in the state, the result of the new task will be the result of the supplied task; otherwise, the result of the new task will be the default value of type .

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ISuppress.SwallowAsync``1(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}},``0)
member.summary: Runs the provided async function and returns its result. If the task does not run to completion, an exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a fallback value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.param: Fallback value to return if the task does not end in the state.
member.returns: A task that represents the completion of the supplied task. If the supplied task ends in the state, the result of the new task will be the result of the supplied task; otherwise, the result of the new task will be the fallback value.

member.summary: Converts input string value into . Parsing is case-insensitive.
member.param: Output value. Null if parse failed

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Common.ConversionHelpers.TryParseEnum``1(System.String,System.Boolean,``0@)
member.summary: Converts the string representation of the name or numeric value of one or more enumerated constants to an equivalent enumerated object. A parameter specifies whether the operation is case-sensitive. The return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.typeparam: The enumeration type to which to convert value.
member.param: The string representation of the enumeration name or underlying value to convert.
true to ignore case; false to consider case.

When this method returns, result contains an object of type TEnum whose value is represented by value if the parse operation succeeds. If the parse operation fails, result contains the default value of the underlying type of TEnum. Note that this value need not be a member of the TEnum enumeration. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if the value parameter was converted successfully; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Wrapper because Enum.TryParse is not present in .net 3.5

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Common.ConversionHelpers.TryParseEnum_net3``1(System.String,System.Boolean,``0@)
member.summary: Enum.TryParse implementation for .net 3.5
member.remarks: Don't uses reflection

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Config.AppDomainFixedOutputAttribute
member.summary: Identifies that the output of layout or layout render does not change for the lifetime of the current appdomain.
member.remarks:
Implementors must have the [ThreadAgnostic] attribute
A layout(renderer) could be converted to a literal when: - The layout and all layout properties are SimpleLayout or [AppDomainFixedOutput]
Recommendation: Apply this attribute to a layout or layout-renderer which have the result only changes by properties of type Layout.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Config.ThreadAgnosticAttribute
member.summary:
Marks the layout or layout renderer as thread independent - it producing correct results regardless of the thread it's running on.
Without this attribute everything is rendered on the main thread.
member.remarks:
If this attribute is set on a layout, it could be rendered on the another thread. This could be more efficient as it's skipped when not needed.
If context like HttpContext.Current is needed, which is only available on the main thread, this attribute should not be applied.
See the AsyncTargetWrapper and BufferTargetWrapper with the , using
Apply this attribute when: - The result can we rendered in another thread. Delaying this could be more efficient. And/Or, - The result should not be precalculated, for example the target sends some extra context information.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Config.ThreadSafeAttribute
member.summary:
Marks the layout or layout renderer as thread safe - it producing correct results regardless of the number of threads it's running on.
Without this attribute then the target concurrency will be reduced

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Config.XmlLoggingConfiguration
member.summary:
A class for configuring NLog through an XML configuration file (App.config style or App.nlog style).
Parsing of the XML file is also implemented in this class.
member.remarks: - This class is thread-safe..ToList() is used for that purpose. - Update TemplateXSD.xml for changes outside targets

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.MappedDiagnosticsLogicalContext
member.summary:
Obsolete and replaced by with NLog v5.
Mapped Diagnostics Logical Context (MDLC) is a dictionary of keys and values. Stores the dictionary in the logical thread callcontext, and provides methods to output dictionary values in layouts. Allows for maintaining state across asynchronous tasks and call contexts.
member.remarks: Ideally, these changes should be incorporated as a new version of the MappedDiagnosticsContext class in the original NLog library so that state can be maintained for multiple threads in asynchronous situations.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.ScopeContext
member.summary: stores state in the async thread execution context. All LogEvents created within a scope can include the scope state in the target output. The logical context scope supports both scope-properties and scope-nested-state-stack (Similar to log4j2 ThreadContext)
member.remarks:
(MDLC), (MDC), (NDLC) and (NDC) have been deprecated and replaced by .
.NetCore (and .Net46) uses AsyncLocal for handling the thread execution context. Older .NetFramework uses System.Runtime.Remoting.CallContext

member.param: Value to added to the scope stack

member.remarks: Scope dictionary keys are case-insensitive

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Internal.FileAppenders.MutexMultiProcessFileAppender
member.summary: Provides a multi process-safe atomic file appends while keeping the files open.
member.remarks: On Unix you can get all the appends to be atomic, even when multiple processes are trying to write to the same file, because setting the file pointer to the end of the file and appending can be made one operation. On Win32 we need to maintain some synchronization between processes (global named mutex is used for this)

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LayoutRenderers.SpecialFolderLayoutRenderer.Folder
member.summary: Gets or sets the system special folder to use.
member.remarks:
Full list of options is available at MSDN. The most common ones are:
CommonApplicationData - application data for all users.
ApplicationData - roaming application data for current user.
LocalApplicationData - non roaming application data for current user
UserProfile - Profile folder for current user
DesktopDirectory - Desktop-directory for current user
MyDocuments - My Documents-directory for current user
System - System directory

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Layouts.Layout.Precalculate(pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogEventInfo)
member.summary:
Precalculates the layout for the specified log event and stores the result in per-log event cache.
Only if the layout doesn't have [ThreadAgnostic] and doesn't contain layouts with [ThreadAgnostic].
member.remarks: Calling this method enables you to store the log event in a buffer and/or potentially evaluate it in another thread even though the layout may contain thread-dependent renderer.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger
member.content:
Logging methods which only are executed when the DEBUG conditional compilation symbol is set.
Remarks: The DEBUG conditional compilation symbol is default enabled (only) in a debug build.
If the DEBUG conditional compilation symbol isn't set in the calling library, the compiler will remove all the invocations to these methods. This could lead to better performance.
See: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/4xssyw96%28v=vs.90%29.aspx
member.summary: Provides logging interface and utility functions.
member.content: Auto-generated Logger members for binary compatibility with NLog 1.0.
member.summary: Provides logging interface and utility functions.

member.summary:
Obsolete and replaced by that prevents unexpected side-effects in Logger-state.
Updates the specified context property for the current logger. The logger will append it for all log events.
With property, all properties can be enumerated (or updated).
member.remarks: It is highly recommended to ONLY use for modifying context properties. This method will affect all locations/contexts that makes use of the same named logger object. And can cause unexpected surprises at multiple locations and other thread contexts.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.Swallow(System.Action)
member.summary: Runs the provided action. If the action throws, the exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.Swallow``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Runs the provided function and returns its result. If an exception is thrown, it is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a default value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.returns: Result returned by the provided function or the default value of type in case of exception.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.Swallow``1(System.Func{``0},``0)
member.summary: Runs the provided function and returns its result. If an exception is thrown, it is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a fallback value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.param: Fallback value to return in case of exception.
member.returns: Result returned by the provided function or fallback value in case of exception.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.Swallow(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Logs an exception is logged at Error level if the provided task does not run to completion.
member.param: The task for which to log an error if it does not run to completion.
member.remarks: This method is useful in fire-and-forget situations, where application logic does not depend on completion of task. This method is avoids C# warning CS4014 in such situations.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.SwallowAsync(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Returns a task that completes when a specified task to completes. If the task does not run to completion, an exception is logged at Error level. The returned task always runs to completion.
member.param: The task for which to log an error if it does not run to completion.
member.returns: A task that completes in the state when completes.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.SwallowAsync(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Runs async action. If the action throws, the exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.SwallowAsync``1(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: Runs the provided async function and returns its result. If the task does not run to completion, an exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a default value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.returns: A task that represents the completion of the supplied task. If the supplied task ends in the state, the result of the new task will be the result of the supplied task; otherwise, the result of the new task will be the default value of type .

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Logger.SwallowAsync``1(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}},``0)
member.summary: Runs the provided async function and returns its result. If the task does not run to completion, an exception is logged at Error level. The exception is not propagated outside of this method; a fallback value is returned instead.
member.typeparam: Return type of the provided function.
member.param: Fallback value to return if the task does not end in the state.
member.returns: A task that represents the completion of the supplied task. If the supplied task ends in the state, the result of the new task will be the result of the supplied task; otherwise, the result of the new task will be the fallback value.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel
member.summary: Defines available log levels.
member.remarks:
Log levels ordered by severity:
- (Ordinal = 0) : Most verbose level. Used for development and seldom enabled in production.
- (Ordinal = 1) : Debugging the application behavior from internal events of interest.
- (Ordinal = 2) : Information that highlights progress or application lifetime events.
- (Ordinal = 3) : Warnings about validation issues or temporary failures that can be recovered.
- (Ordinal = 4) : Errors where functionality has failed or have been caught.
- (Ordinal = 5) : Most critical level. Application is about to abort.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel.Trace
member.summary: Trace log level (Ordinal = 0)
member.remarks: Most verbose level. Used for development and seldom enabled in production.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel.Debug
member.summary: Debug log level (Ordinal = 1)
member.remarks: Debugging the application behavior from internal events of interest.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel.Info
member.summary: Info log level (Ordinal = 2)
member.remarks: Information that highlights progress or application lifetime events.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel.Warn
member.summary: Warn log level (Ordinal = 3)
member.remarks: Warnings about validation issues or temporary failures that can be recovered.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel.Error
member.summary: Error log level (Ordinal = 4)
member.remarks: Errors where functionality has failed or have been caught.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel.Fatal
member.summary: Fatal log level (Ordinal = 5)
member.remarks: Most critical level. Application is about to abort.

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.LogLevel.Off
member.summary: Off log level (Ordinal = 6)

member.summary: Gets all the available log levels (Trace, Debug, Info, Warn, Error, Fatal, Off).

member.summary: Configure the InternalLogger properties from Environment-variables and App.config using
member.remarks:
Recognizes the following environment-variables:
- NLOG_INTERNAL_LOG_LEVEL - NLOG_INTERNAL_LOG_FILE - NLOG_INTERNAL_LOG_TO_CONSOLE - NLOG_INTERNAL_LOG_TO_CONSOLE_ERROR - NLOG_INTERNAL_LOG_TO_TRACE - NLOG_INTERNAL_INCLUDE_TIMESTAMP
Legacy .NetFramework platform will also recognizes the following app.config settings:
- nlog.internalLogLevel - nlog.internalLogFile - nlog.internalLogToConsole - nlog.internalLogToConsoleError - nlog.internalLogToTrace - nlog.internalLogIncludeTimestamp

member.summary: Sequence style numbering. The most recent archive has the highest number.

member.summary: Rolling style numbering (the most recent is always #0 then #1, ..., #N.

member.summary: Date and sequence style numbering. Archives will be stamped with the prior period (Year, Month, Day) datetime. The most recent archive has the highest number (in combination with the date).

member.name: F:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.ColoredConsoleTarget._pauseLogging
member.summary: Should logging being paused/stopped because of the race condition bug in Console.Writeline?
member.remarks:
Console.Out.Writeline / Console.Error.Writeline could throw 'IndexOutOfRangeException', which is a bug. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33915790/console-out-and-console-error-race-condition-error-in-a-windows-service-written and https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/2057284/console-out-probable-i-o-race-condition-issue-in-multi-threaded-windows-service
Full error: Error during session close: System.IndexOutOfRangeException: Probable I/ O race condition detected while copying memory. The I/ O package is not thread safe by default. In multi-threaded applications, a stream must be accessed in a thread-safe way, such as a thread - safe wrapper returned by TextReader's or TextWriter's Synchronized methods.This also applies to classes like StreamWriter and StreamReader.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.ColoredConsoleTarget.UseDefaultRowHighlightingRules
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use default row highlighting rules.
member.remarks:
The default rules are:
Condition Foreground Color Background Color
level == LogLevel.Fatal Red NoChange
level == LogLevel.Error Yellow NoChange
level == LogLevel.Warn Magenta NoChange
level == LogLevel.Info White NoChange
level == LogLevel.Debug Gray NoChange
level == LogLevel.Trace DarkGray NoChange

member.summary:
Archives the log-files using a date style numbering. Archives will be stamped with the prior period (Year, Month, Day, Hour, Minute) datetime.
When the number of archive files exceed the obsolete archives are deleted. When the age of archive files exceed the obsolete archives are deleted.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileArchiveModes.FileArchiveModeDateAndSequence
member.summary:
Archives the log-files using a date and sequence style numbering. Archives will be stamped with the prior period (Year, Month, Day) datetime. The most recent archive has the highest number (in combination with the date).
When the number of archive files exceed the obsolete archives are deleted. When the age of archive files exceed the obsolete archives are deleted.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileArchiveModes.FileArchiveModeDynamicSequence
member.summary:
Archives the log-files using the provided base-archive-filename. If the base-archive-filename causes duplicate archive filenames, then sequence-style is automatically enforced.
Example: Base Filename trace.log Next Filename trace.0.log
The most recent archive has the highest number.
When the number of archive files exceed the obsolete archives are deleted. When the age of archive files exceed the obsolete archives are deleted.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileArchiveModes.FileArchiveModeFactory.ContainsFileNamePattern(System.String)
member.summary:
Determines if the file name as contains a numeric pattern i.e. {#} in it.
Example: trace{#}.log Contains the numeric pattern. trace{###}.log Contains the numeric pattern. trace{#X#}.log Contains the numeric pattern (See remarks). trace.log Does not contain the pattern.
member.remarks: Occasionally, this method can identify the existence of the {#} pattern incorrectly.
member.returns: when the pattern is found; otherwise.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileArchiveModes.FileArchiveModeRolling
member.summary:
Archives the log-files using a rolling style numbering (the most recent is always #0 then #1, ..., #N.
When the number of archive files exceed the obsolete archives are deleted.

Value which will replace the numeric pattern.
member.returns: File name with the value of in the position of the numeric pattern.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file to write to.
member.remarks: This FileName string is a layout which may include instances of layout renderers. This lets you use a single target to write to multiple files.
member.example: The following value makes NLog write logging events to files based on the log level in the directory where the application runs. ${basedir}/${level}.log All Debug messages will go to Debug.log, all Info messages will go to Info.log and so on. You can combine as many of the layout renderers as you want to produce an arbitrary log file name.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.CleanupFileName
member.summary: Cleanup invalid values in a filename, e.g. slashes in a filename. If set to true, this can impact the performance of massive writes. If set to false, nothing gets written when the filename is wrong.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.FileNameKind
member.summary: Is the an absolute or relative path?

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.CreateDirs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create directories if they do not exist.
member.remarks: Setting this to false may improve performance a bit, but you'll receive an error when attempting to write to a directory that's not present.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.DeleteOldFileOnStartup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to delete old log file on startup.
member.remarks: This option works only when the "FileName" parameter denotes a single file.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ReplaceFileContentsOnEachWrite
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to replace file contents on each write instead of appending log message at the end.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.KeepFileOpen
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to keep log file open instead of opening and closing it on each logging event.
member.remarks:
KeepFileOpen = true gives the best performance, and ensure the file-lock is not lost to other applications.
KeepFileOpen = false gives the best compability, but slow performance and lead to file-locking issues with other applications.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.EnableFileDelete
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable log file(s) to be deleted.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.FileAttributes
member.summary: Gets or sets the file attributes (Windows only).

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.LineEnding
member.summary: Gets or sets the line ending mode.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.AutoFlush
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically flush the file buffers after each log message.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.OpenFileCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of files to be kept open. Setting this to a higher value may improve performance in a situation where a single File target is writing to many files (such as splitting by level or by logger).
member.remarks: The files are managed on a LRU (least recently used) basis, which flushes the files that have not been used for the longest period of time should the cache become full. As a rule of thumb, you shouldn't set this parameter to a very high value. A number like 10-15 shouldn't be exceeded, because you'd be keeping a large number of files open which consumes system resources.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.OpenFileCacheTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of seconds that files are kept open. Zero or negative means disabled.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.OpenFileFlushTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of seconds before open files are flushed. Zero or negative means disabled.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.BufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the log file buffer size in bytes.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the file encoding.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.DiscardAll
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not this target should just discard all data that its asked to write. Mostly used for when testing NLog Stack except final write

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ConcurrentWrites
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether concurrent writes to the log file by multiple processes on the same host.
member.remarks: This makes multi-process logging possible. NLog uses a special technique that lets it keep the files open for writing.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.NetworkWrites
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether concurrent writes to the log file by multiple processes on different network hosts.
member.remarks: This effectively prevents files from being kept open.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.WriteBom
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to write BOM (byte order mark) in created files.
Defaults to true for UTF-16 and UTF-32

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ConcurrentWriteAttempts
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of times the write is appended on the file before NLog discards the log message.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ConcurrentWriteAttemptDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds to wait before attempting to write to the file again.
member.remarks: The actual delay is a random value between 0 and the value specified in this parameter. On each failed attempt the delay base is doubled up to times.
member.example:
Assuming that ConcurrentWriteAttemptDelay is 10 the time to wait will be:
a random value between 0 and 10 milliseconds - 1st attempt
a random value between 0 and 20 milliseconds - 2nd attempt
a random value between 0 and 40 milliseconds - 3rd attempt
a random value between 0 and 80 milliseconds - 4th attempt
...
and so on.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ArchiveOldFileOnStartup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to archive old log file on startup.
member.remarks: This option works only when the "FileName" parameter denotes a single file. After archiving the old file, the current log file will be empty.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.WriteHeaderWhenInitialFileNotEmpty
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to write the Header on initial creation of file appender, even if the file is not empty. Default value is , which means only write header when initial file is empty (Ex. ensures valid CSV files)
member.remarks: Alternative use to ensure each application session gets individual log-file.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ArchiveOldFileOnStartupAboveSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value of the file size threshold to archive old log file on startup.
member.remarks: This option won't work if is set to false Default value is 0 which means that the file is archived as soon as archival on startup is enabled.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ArchiveDateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying the date format to use when archiving files.
member.remarks: This option works only when the "ArchiveNumbering" parameter is set either to Date or DateAndSequence.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ArchiveAboveSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size in bytes above which log files will be automatically archived.
member.remarks: Notice when combined with then it will attempt to append to any existing archive file if grown above size multiple times. New archive file will be created when using

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ArchiveEvery
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically archive log files every time the specified time passes.
member.remarks: Files are moved to the archive as part of the write operation if the current period of time changes. For example if the current hour changes from 10 to 11, the first write that will occur on or after 11:00 will trigger the archiving.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.FileTarget.ArchiveFileKind

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.NetworkTarget
member.summary: Sends log messages over the network.

example.p: To set up the target in the configuration file, use the following syntax:
To set up the log target programmatically use code like this:

To print the results, use any application that's able to receive messages over TCP or UDP. NetCat is a simple but very powerful command-line tool that can be used for that. This image demonstrates the NetCat tool receiving log messages from Network target.
There are two specialized versions of the Network target: Chainsaw and NLogViewer which write to instances of Chainsaw log4j viewer or NLogViewer application respectively.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.NetworkTarget.Address
member.summary: Gets or sets the network address.
member.remarks:
The network address can be:
tcp://host:port - TCP (auto select IPv4/IPv6)
tcp4://host:port - force TCP/IPv4
tcp6://host:port - force TCP/IPv6
udp://host:port - UDP (auto select IPv4/IPv6)
udp4://host:port - force UDP/IPv4
udp6://host:port - force UDP/IPv6
http://host:port/pageName - HTTP using POST verb
https://host:port/pageName - HTTPS using POST verb
For SOAP-based webservice support over HTTP use WebService target.

member.remarks:

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.NetworkTarget.ConnectionCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the connection cache (number of connections which are kept alive). Requires = true

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.NetworkTarget.OnOverflow
member.summary: Gets or sets the action that should be taken if the message is larger than
member.remarks:
For TCP sockets then means no-limit, as TCP sockets performs splitting automatically.
For UDP Network sender then means splitting the message into smaller chunks. This can be useful on networks using DontFragment, which drops network packages larger than MTU-size (1472 bytes).

member.summary: Split the message into smaller pieces. Only relevant for UDP sockets, as TCP sockets does it automatically.
member.remarks: Udp-Network-Sender will split the message into smaller chunks that matches . This can avoid network-package-drop when network uses DontFragment and message is larger than MTU-size (1472 bytes).

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.Target.LayoutWithLock
member.summary:
NLog Layout are by default threadsafe, so multiple threads can be rendering logevents at the same time. This ensure high concurrency with no lock-congestion for the application-threads, especially when using or AsyncTaskTarget.
But if using custom or that are not threadsafe, then this option can enabled to protect against thread-concurrency-issues. Allowing one to update to NLog 5.0 without having to fix custom/external layout-dependencies.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.Target.WriteAsyncThreadSafe(pyRevitLabs.NLog.Common.AsyncLogEventInfo)
member.summary:
Writes a log event to the log target, in a thread safe manner. Any override of this method has to provide their own synchronization mechanism.
!WARNING! Custom targets should only override this method if able to provide their own synchronization mechanism. -objects are not guaranteed to be thread-safe, so using them without a SyncRoot-object can be dangerous.
member.param: Log event to be written out.

member.summary: Writes an array of logging events to the log target. By default it iterates on all events and passes them to "Write" method. Inheriting classes can use this method to optimize batch writes.
member.param: Logging events to be written out.

member.name: T:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.Wrappers.AsyncTargetWrapper
member.summary: Provides asynchronous, buffered execution of target writes.

remarks.p: Asynchronous target wrapper allows the logger code to execute more quickly, by queuing messages and processing them in a separate thread. You should wrap targets that spend a non-trivial amount of time in their Write() method with asynchronous target to speed up logging.

Because asynchronous logging is quite a common scenario, NLog supports a shorthand notation for wrapping all targets with AsyncWrapper. Just add async="true" to the <targets/> element in the configuration file.

example.p: To set up the target in the configuration file, use the following syntax:

member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout (in milliseconds) after which the contents of buffer will be flushed if there's no write in the specified period of time. Use -1 to disable timed flushes.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.Wrappers.BufferingTargetWrapper.SlidingTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use sliding timeout.
member.remarks: This value determines how the inactivity period is determined. If sliding timeout is enabled, the inactivity timer is reset after each write, if it is disabled - inactivity timer will count from the first event written to the buffer.

member.name: P:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.Wrappers.BufferingTargetWrapper.OverflowAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the action to take if the buffer overflows.
member.remarks: Setting to will replace the oldest event with new events without sending events down to the wrapped target, and setting to will flush the entire buffer to the wrapped target.

member.summary: Flushes pending events in the buffer (if any), followed by flushing the WrappedTarget.

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Targets.Wrappers.RoundRobinGroupTarget.Write(pyRevitLabs.NLog.Common.AsyncLogEventInfo)
member.summary: Forwards the write to one of the targets from the collection.
member.remarks: The writes are routed in a round-robin fashion. The first log event goes to the first target, the second one goes to the second target and so on looping to the first target when there are no more targets available. In general request N goes to Targets[N % Targets.Count].

member.name: M:pyRevitLabs.NLog.Time.TimeSource.FromSystemTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Converts the specified system time to the same form as the time value originated from this time source.
member.param: The system originated time value to convert.
member.returns: The value of converted to the same form as time values originated from this source.

remarks.para: There are situations when NLog have to compare the time originated from TimeSource to the time originated externally in the system. To be able to provide meaningful result of such comparisons the system time must be expressed in the same form as TimeSource time.

Examples: - If the TimeSource provides time values of local time, it should also convert the provided to the local time. - If the TimeSource shifts or skews its time values, it should also apply the same transform to the given .

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed.
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output.
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If the method has a single input parameter, its name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for the method output means that the method doesn't return normally (throws or terminates the process).
Value canbenull is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by the semicolon. There is no notion of order rows, all rows are checked for applicability and applied per each program state tracked by the analysis engine.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("null <= param:null")] // reverse condition syntax public string GetName(string surname)
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("=> true, result: notnull; => false, result: null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute

Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will be ignored by usage-checking inspections.
You can use and to configure how this attribute is applied.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Can be applied to attributes, type parameters, and parameters of a type assignable from . When applied to an attribute, the decorated attribute behaves the same as . When applied to a type parameter or to a parameter of type , indicates that the corresponding type is used implicitly.

member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member.

member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type.

member.summary: Specifies what is considered to be used implicitly when marked with or .

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API, which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells the code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate can only be invoked during method execution (the delegate can be invoked zero or multiple times, but not stored to some field and invoked later, when the containing method is no longer on the execution stack). If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed. If is true, the attribute will only takes effect if the method invocation is located under the 'await' expression.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute.RequireAwait
member.summary: Require the method invocation to be used under the 'await' expression for this attribute to take effect on code analysis engine. Can be used for delegate/enumerable parameters of 'async' methods.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MustUseReturnValueAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the return value of the method invocation must be used.
member.remarks:
Methods decorated with this attribute (in contrast to pure methods) might change state, but make no sense without using their return value.
Similarly to , this attribute will help to detect usages of the method when the return value is not used. Optionally, you can specify a message to use when showing warnings, e.g. [MustUseReturnValue("Use the return value to...")].

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.RequireStaticDelegateAttribute
member.summary: This annotation allows to enforce allocation-less usage patterns of delegates for performance-critical APIs. When this annotation is applied to the parameter of delegate type, IDE checks the input argument of this parameter: * When lambda expression or anonymous method is passed as an argument, IDE verifies that the passed closure has no captures of the containing local variables and the compiler is able to cache the delegate instance to avoid heap allocations. Otherwise the warning is produced. * IDE warns when method name or local function name is passed as an argument as this always results in heap allocation of the delegate instance.
member.remarks: In C# 9.0 code IDE would also suggest to annotate the anonymous function with 'static' modifier to make use of the similar analysis provided by the language/compiler.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.ProvidesContextAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the type member or parameter of some type, that should be used instead of all other ways to get the value of that type. This annotation is useful when you have some "context" value evaluated and stored somewhere, meaning that all other ways to get this value must be consolidated with existing one.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.SourceTemplateAttribute
member.summary: An extension method marked with this attribute is processed by code completion as a 'Source Template'. When the extension method is completed over some expression, its source code is automatically expanded like a template at call site.
member.remarks: Template method body can contain valid source code and/or special comments starting with '$'. Text inside these comments is added as source code when the template is applied. Template parameters can be used either as additional method parameters or as identifiers wrapped in two '$' signs. Use the attribute to specify macros for parameters.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.MacroAttribute
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro for a parameter of a source template.
member.remarks: You can apply the attribute on the whole method or on any of its additional parameters. The macro expression is defined in the property. When applied on a method, the target template parameter is defined in the property. To apply the macro silently for the parameter, set the property value = -1.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Expression
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro that will be executed for a source template parameter when the template is expanded.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Editable
member.summary: Allows specifying which occurrence of the target parameter becomes editable when the template is deployed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Target
member.summary: Identifies the target parameter of a source template if the is applied on a template method.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.CollectionAccessAttribute
member.summary: Indicates how method, constructor invocation, or property access over collection type affects the contents of the collection. When applied to a return value of a method indicates if the returned collection is created exclusively for the caller (CollectionAccessType.UpdatedContent) or can be read/updated from outside (CollectionAccessType.Read | CollectionAccessType.UpdatedContent) Use to specify the access type.
member.remarks: Using this attribute only makes sense if all collection methods are marked with this attribute.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.CollectionAccessType
member.summary: Provides a value for the to define how the collection method invocation affects the contents of the collection.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.None
member.summary: Method does not use or modify content of the collection.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.Read
member.summary: Method only reads content of the collection but does not modify it.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.ModifyExistingContent
member.summary: Method can change content of the collection but does not add new elements.

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.UpdatedContent
member.summary: Method can add new elements to the collection.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionMethodAttribute

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the condition parameter of the assertion method. The method itself should be marked by attribute. The mandatory argument of the attribute is the assertion type.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType

member.name: F:JetBrains.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_NOT_NULL

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.TerminatesProgramAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method unconditionally terminates control flow execution. For example, it could unconditionally throw exception.

member.name: T:JetBrains.Annotations.LinqTunnelAttribute

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute
member.summary: Suppresses reporting of a specific rule violation, allowing multiple suppressions on a single code artifact.
member.remarks: is different than in that it doesn't have a . So it is always preserved in the compiled assembly.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the category of the tool and the identifier for an analysis rule.
member.param: The identifier of the analysis rule the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Category
member.summary: Gets the category identifying the classification of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property describes the tool or tool analysis category for which a message suppression attribute applies.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.CheckId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the analysis tool rule to be suppressed.
member.remarks: Concatenated together, the and properties form a unique check identifier.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the code that is relevant for the attribute.
member.remarks: The Scope property is an optional argument that specifies the metadata scope for which the attribute is relevant.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Justification
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification for suppressing the code analysis message.
